issues.title: zab-dump: support capture zk packet from loopback device and ignore null packet
issues.body:
- zab-dump: support capture zk packet from loopback device and ignore null packet
- add .idea to .gitignore

issues.title: Requests that span more than one TCP packet are misinterpreted.
issues.body:
If one makes a request to a server that is large (say, larger than the current MTU), and it is broken up in the network, the second packet will get misinterpreted as a new request and does all sorts of nutty things, depending on what data overflows into the subsequent packets. 

I suspect that multiple requests in the same packet may be ignored.

issues.title: unhandled exceptions in zktraffic/base/sniffer.py handle_packet
issues.body:
in sniffer.py, if there are exceptions that aren't specifically called out, the daemon just quits without logging anything.  I'm specifically seeing StringTooLong exceptions, but there may be others.

It looks like this was addressed in omni_sniffer, catching any other exceptions in the handle_packet method:

``` python
    except Exception as ex:
      print("got: %s" % str(ex))
      hexdump.hexdump(packet.load)
      traceback.print_exc()
      sys.stdout.flush()
```

We are working on a fix, but it may take some time here to put together a pull request.

issues.title: Expose counters for distinct (i.e.: data, exists, children) watches set with SetWatchesRequest
SetWatchesRequest not appearing in /json/paths
issues.body:
This is similar to what happened with Multi() request, we need to either pick the first one or convert something like:

```
SetWatchesRequest(/foo, /bar)
```

into

```
SetWatchesRequest(/foo)
SetWatchesRequest(/bar)
```

so that we account correctly (albeit, at the expense of more mem).

commit.message:
Merge pull request #69 from sel-fish/develop

support capture zk packet from loopback device and ignore null packet
remove debug mesg
support capture zk packet from loopback device

Merge pull request #67 from rgs1/make-bytes-optional

Make bytes optional

Release 0.1.8

Signed-off-by: Raul Gutierrez Segales <rgs@itevenworks.net>

fix(accumulators): treat unset paths like /

Some requests have no paths associated (i.e.: Connect). While
others might have multiple paths (i.e.: SetWatches). For
consistency, if the path is not set treat it as /.

feature(zk-stats-daemon): add --exclude-bytes

This new flag is useful when you want to reduce the number
of exported metrics via /json/paths. With it, only number
of requests per path and type will be exported.

refactor(accumulators): make bytes accounting optional

We have a use case in which we only care about the number of requests,
but not the total sizes. This makes this accounting optional.

The next step is to wire this up from stats_daemon.py.
refactor(accumulators): remove unused log.debug calls

Release 0.1.7

Signed-off-by: Raul Gutierrez Segales <rgs@itevenworks.net>

Merge pull request #65 from rgs1/perf-improvements

Perf improvements

feature(zk-stats-daemon): add support for --sampling

Analyzing every packet is probably too much CPU usage
for most cases. It's easy to get an idea of which
paths are the busiest by inspecting a decent sized
sample (i.e.: 10% of packets).

This can now be done via:

```
ZKTRAFFIC_SOURCE=1 bin/zk-stats-daemon \
  --iface=eth0 \
  --http-port=9090 \
  --http-address=127.0.0.1 \
  --set-cpu-affinity=0 \
  --sampling=0.1
```

refactor(sniffer): delay calling intern()

Via perf top I saw a few calls that look to be
triggered via the excessive calls to intern().

This avoids calling intern() for packets that'll
potentially be ignored.

fix(loaders): wake up less often

Two potential improvements here:

* no need to process stats _every_ time a new message
  arrives. It's fine to do it with a 1 sec granularity
* given that we don't wait on the condition var anymore,
  there is no need to lock/notify when a new message
  is added

I did some observations via:

```
perf stat -e 'syscalls:sys_enter_*' -p $pid sleep 2
```

and the result is that we now see more (not consistently though)
done (i.e.: more packets picked up by calling sys_enter_recvfrom).

fix(stats_daemon): don't wake up every 10 secs

Calling join() on the sniffer thread is much better
than waking up every 10 secs...

Merge pull request #64 from rgs1/fix-cpu-affinity

fix(stats-daemon): call set_cpu_affinity() before spawning threads
fix(stats-daemon): call set_cpu_affinity() before spawning threads

Merge pull request #63 from rgs1/fix-requirements

fix(requirements): add missing dep ansicolors
fix(requirements): add missing dep ansicolors

Merge pull request #61 from bensherman/stringtoolong

Stringtoolong
Fixed typo (no S exception)
added handler for StringTooLong exception

Merge pull request #57 from AkihiroSuda/suda/readme-note-tcp-autocorking

doc(README): mention Linux (>= 3.14) TCP Auto Corking

Merge pull request #58 from bonifaido/patch-1

dnet is needed on OS X
dnet is needed on OS X
doc(README): mention Linux (>= 3.14) TCP Auto Corking, which especially impedes FLE sniffer

Merge pull request #55 from AkihiroSuda/suda/fix-missing-tests

fix missing tests (Zab, four-letter, quorum config) and some chores
chore(tests): support multiple CIs
tests(packets): cover four-letter packets
tests(parse_config): improve coverage

repo.name: zktraffic

repo.name: zktraffic
repo.description: ZooKeeper protocol analyzer and stats gathering daemon

issue_comments.body: Awesome, thanks!!

@phobos182 any chance you can take the psutil-calling code and put it into a module under zktraffic so it can be tested? I'm a fan of psutil, but I think we need to have some API-coverage to protect against changes coming down the pipe.

Alternative ideas to make testing this easier (and keep the stuff in bin/ small) appreciated!
Will do. Going to rebase a new PR.
Rebased a new PR and squashed commits. Added two simple tests. Give it a look over?
Updated PR for comments. Waiting for tests.
Finally wrestled Travis down to pass tests. Figured out that Travis mocks cpu_affinity, and does not allow it to happen for reals.
Just a few small notes then we'll get this merged- thanks so much @phobos182!
Thanks for the notes. Updated PR from comments. Added mock() for TravisCI tests on cpu_affinity call.

done: https://github.com/twitter/zktraffic/releases/tag/0.1.0

+""" process helpers """

+import os
+
+from twitter.common import log
+
+import psutil
+
+
+class ProcessOptions(object):
+
+    def __init__(self):
+        self.process = psutil.Process(os.getpid())
+
+    def set_cpu_affinity(self, cpu_affinity_csv):
+        try:
+            cpu_affinity_list = [int(_) for _ in cpu_affinity_csv.split(',')]
+            self.process.set_cpu_affinity(cpu_affinity_list)

review_comments.body: Not that you should fix this in this round, but I think we [should use mock](http://mock.readthedocs.org/en/latest/) to enable tests on travis. We (the zktraffic-community) can also have a test suite that can be run when not on travis as well, but let's get this in and pick that up later.

``` python
"""Set the CPU Affinity for the current process.

:param cpu_affinity_csv: Which CPUs to pin this process to
:type cpu_affinity_csv: string with comma separated values
"""
```

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -154,6 +155,54 @@ Other relevant endpoints for stats are:
 * /json/auths: per-auth stats
 * /json/auths-dump: a full dump of known auths
 
+### More tools! ###
+
+Along with zk-dump and zk-stats-daemon, you can find fle-dump which allows you
+to inspect FastLeaderElection traffic (i.e.: the protocol by which ZooKeeper decides
+who will lead and also the mechanism by which the leader is subsequently discovered):
review_comments.body: Ditch the "also" in "also the mechanism"

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,86 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python
+# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
+
+# ==================================================================================================
+# Copyright 2014 Twitter, Inc.
+# --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
+# you may not use this work except in compliance with the License.
+# You may obtain a copy of the License in the LICENSE file, or at:
+#
+#  http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+# limitations under the License.
+# ==================================================================================================
+
+from collections import deque
+import os
+from threading import Thread
+import time
+import sys
+
+if os.getenv("ZKTRAFFIC_SOURCE") is not None:
+  sys.path.insert(0,  "..")
+  sys.path.insert(0, ".")
+
+from zktraffic.fle.sniffer import Sniffer
+
+import colors
+from twitter.common import app
+
+
+app.add_option('--iface', default='eth0', type=str)
+app.add_option('--port', default=3888, type=int)
+app.add_option('-c', '--colors', default=False, action='store_true')
+
+
+class Printer(Thread):
+  def __init__(self, colors):
+    super(Printer, self).__init__()
+    self.setDaemon(True)
+    self._queue = deque()
+    self._print = self._print_color if colors else self._print_default
+
+  def run(self):
+    while True:
+      try:
+        msg = self._queue.popleft()
+      except IndexError:
+        time.sleep(0.1)
+        continue
+
+      self._print(msg)

@@ -0,0 +1,133 @@
+# ==================================================================================================
+# Copyright 2014 Twitter, Inc.
+# --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
+# you may not use this work except in compliance with the License.
+# You may obtain a copy of the License in the LICENSE file, or at:
+#
+#  http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+# limitations under the License.
+# ==================================================================================================
+
+from datetime import datetime
+
+from zktraffic.base.network import BadPacket
+from zktraffic.base.util import read_long, read_number, read_string
+
+
+class PeerState(object):
+  LOOKING = 0
+  FOLLOWING = 1
+  LEADING = 2
+  OBSERVING = 3
+  STATES = [LOOKING, FOLLOWING, LEADING, OBSERVING]
+  NAMES = [
+    "looking",
+    "following",
+    "leading",
+    "observing",
+  ]
+
+  @classmethod
+  def invalid(cls, state):
+    return state not in cls.STATES
+
+  @classmethod
+  def to_str(cls, state):
+    return "" if cls.invalid(state) else cls.NAMES[state]
+
+
+class Message(object):
+  @classmethod
+  def from_payload(self, data, src):
+    if len(data) < 16:
+      raise BadPacket("Too small")
+
+    proto, offset = read_long(data, 0)
+    if proto == -65536:
+      server_id, offset = read_long(data, offset)
+      election_addr, _ = read_string(data, offset)
+
+      return Initial(src, server_id, election_addr)
+
+    if len(data) >= 28:
+      state, offset = read_number(data, 0)
+      if PeerState.invalid(state):
+        raise BadPacket("Invalid state: %d" % state)
+
+      leader, offset = read_long(data, offset)
+      zxid, offset = read_long(data, offset)
+      election_epoch, offset = read_long(data, offset)
+      peer_epoch, offset = read_long(data, offset) if len(data) > 28 else (-1, offset)
+      config = data[36:] if len(data) > 36 else ""
+
+      return Notification(src, state, leader, zxid, election_epoch, peer_epoch, config)
+
+    raise BadPacket("Unknown unknown")
review_comments.body: SO MANY MAGIC NUMBERS
